Getting started with gwasrapidd

Source: vignettes/gwasrapidd.Rmd
gwasrapidd.Rmd

Overview

gwasrapidd is a REST API R client for the GWAS Catalog, allowing you to programatically download:

  • Studies with get_studies()
  • Associations with get_associations()
  • Variants with get_variants()
  • Traits with get_traits()

Each function returns an S4 object that encapsulates a set of tables (dataframes), that together, form a relational database for each object type.

Installation

# Install the development version from GitHub:
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("ramiromagno/gwasrapidd")

Cheatsheet

TODO

Getting started

The GWAS Catalog is a service provided by the EMBL-EBI and NHGRI that offers a manually curated and freely available database of published genome-wide association studies (GWAS). The Catalog website and infrastructure is hosted by the EMBL-EBI.

There are three ways to access the Catalog database:

  • Via the Web interface at https://www.ebi.ac.uk/gwas
  • By downloading a database dump in TSV or RDF/OWL formats: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/gwas/docs/file-downloads
  • Or through the GWAS Catalog REST API: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/gwas/rest/docs/api

gwasrapidd facilitates the access to the Catalog via the Catalog REST API, allowing you to programmatically retrieve data directly into R.

Usage

The Catalog REST API provides four types of data objects for retrieval:

  • Studies
  • Associations
  • Variants
  • Traits

gwasrapidd provides four corresponding functions to get each of the object types:

  • get_studies()
  • get_associations()
  • get_variants()
  • get_traits()

Examples

Searching for information about Diabetes mellitus
